name: Surveillance & Data Exploitation Index
summary: Collection breadth, integration depth, and analytic capability of surveillance systems are high, while access governance and rights remedies remain uneven.

components.name: Collection Breadth
components.summary: Large and growing number of data sources (telecom, location, financial, biometric) feeding into government or state-aligned systems.

components.name: Integration & Linkability
components.summary: Multiple datasets are linked through shared identifiers and entity-resolution tools, enabling cross-context tracking.

components.name: Analytic Capability
components.summary: Pattern-of-life analysis, risk scoring, and AI-assisted search capabilities are widely available to enforcement and intelligence actors.

components.name: Access Governance (raw)
components.summary: Role-based access and basic audit logging exist, but enforcement is inconsistent and exceptions are common.

components.name: Rights & Remedies (raw)
components.summary: Individuals have limited visibility into how their data is used and few practical avenues to correct, contest, or limit exploitation.

notes: Values are illustrative alpha scores to exercise the SDEI module page.
In production, SDEI would be derived from tagged contracts, statutory frameworks, audit reports, and documented abuses or remedies in the surveillance and data space.
